Interface ComputeBackend

All Known Subinterfaces:
LinearAlgebraProvider<E>, TensorProvider
All Known Implementing Classes:
CPUBackend, CPULinearAlgebraProvider, CPUSparseLinearAlgebraProvider, CPUTensorProvider, CudaBackend, CudaDenseLinearAlgebraProvider, CudaRealLinearAlgebraProvider, CudaSparseLinearAlgebraProvider, ND4JTensorProvider, OpenCLBackend, OpenCLLinearAlgebraProvider
public interface ComputeBackend
Service Provider Interface for pluggable compute backends.

Implementations can provide CPU, GPU, quantum, or distributed computing backends. Backends are discovered automatically via ServiceLoader.

Usage: 

ComputeBackend backend = BackendManager.getDefault();
try (ExecutionContext ctx = backend.createContext()) {
    result = ctx.execute(operation);
}

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot (silvere.martin@gmail.com), Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

    Method

    Creates an execution context for running operations.
    String

    Returns the name of this backend (e.g., "CPU", "GPU-CUDA", "IBM-Qiskit").
    default int

    Returns the priority of this backend for automatic selection.

    Checks if this backend is currently available.
    default boolean

    default boolean
    supportsParallelOps()
    Checks if this backend supports parallel operations.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the name of this backend (e.g., "CPU", "GPU-CUDA", "IBM-Qiskit").
      Returns:
      backend name

    • isAvailable

      boolean isAvailable()
      Checks if this backend is currently available.

      For example, a GPU backend might return false if no GPU is detected.

      Returns:
      true if backend can be used, false otherwise

    • createContext

      ExecutionContext createContext()
      Creates an execution context for running operations.

      The context should be used within a try-with-resources block to ensure proper cleanup of resources.

      Returns:
      new execution context
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if backend is not available

    • supportsParallelOps

      default boolean supportsParallelOps()
      Checks if this backend supports parallel operations.
      Returns:
      true if parallel execution is supported

    • supportsFloatingPoint

      default boolean supportsFloatingPoint()
      Checks if this backend supports floating-point arithmetic.
      Returns:
      true if floating-point is supported

    • supportsComplexNumbers

      default boolean supportsComplexNumbers()
      Checks if this backend supports complex number arithmetic.
      Returns:
      true if complex numbers are supported

    • getPriority

      default int getPriority()
      Returns the priority of this backend for automatic selection. Higher values indicate higher priority.

      Default priorities:

      • CPU: 0 (fallback)
      • GPU: 10
      • Quantum: 5 (specialized use cases)

      Returns:
      priority value
